content.description: On the Northeast (back) side of the Circus Roof boulder, about 15’ left of the start of Circus Roof there is a large jug rail about 3&1/2 feet off the ground. Starting on the jug rail with a few options for high positive feet, climb the overhang via either of two distinct lines, right or left. The rock quality is good, the moves are fun, and the topouts are relatively clean. These are great warmups, and fun in their own right, making it a little more worthwhile to visit the CR.
content.location: On the Northeast (back) side of the Circus Roof boulder, about 15’ left of the start of Circus Roof.

content.description: This is a variation of the ultra classic Circus Roof. Start low on a shelf at the back of the roof. Follow the obvious crack system until it runs out. Then move up and left to small crimps, look for good feet and a right heel hook. make a big move left to a good jug. Match the jug, move the feet high on the right side of the wall and make another big move to a final jug. A right heel hook here will help you move through the topout. This problem has 20 ft of really good roof climbing.
content.protection: At least 3 pads to cover a large rock directly under the crux.
content.location: On the Circus Roof boulder. Shared start with Circus Roof, matched on a shelf at the very back of the roof.

content.description: Start on the far right of the roof, just left of the tree with a heel hook. Heel hook and toe hook along the edge of the roof for about 12-15 feet. Top out in the notch in the roof.
content.protection: pads and spotter to drag pads
content.location: Located on the Circus Roof boulder

climbs.name: Out of the Bear Cave and Into the Circus

content.description: Tricky beta down low to a big move unlocks access to the Circus Roof crack system to progress upward.
content.location: Start matched on the edge deep and left of Circus Roof start. Find beta to move up and right into the moves of Circus Roof and finish in the same fashion.

content.description: Originally a project in the Moore's Wall Guide, this problem begins on the start of Circus Roof, but instead of continuing up and left into the jugs, move right into crimps with foot trickery to a committing move to the lip before gaining better holds. FA top-out came originally to the lip and mantled with no traversing.
content.location: Start and climb on Circus Roof but move right into crimps before the big upward lunge to a jug before the top. Do not traverse right along the lip.

content.description: Super classic endurance roof problem on good holds. SDS on a small ledge at the back wall under the roof. Follow the weakness and jugs across the horizontal roof and exit through a huge notch in the lip.
content.location: The Circus Roof boulder is just of the Moore's Wall Loop. From the junction with the Tory's Den trail take the Moore's Wall Loop uphill about 50 yards an the boulder should be in the woods on your right.

content.description: A climb that has a low, easily protected crux followed by consistent, pumpy climbing. Will feel easier than V8 with a wealth of power endurance.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter
content.location: Start on the lowest right chalked block of Circus Roof boulder, move to crimps to eventually join Redneck Trapeze start on the lip. Follow Redneck Trapeze into the shared top-out of Redneck and Circus Roof.
